title: Awesome List Updates on Sep 04, 2022
_seo_title: Awesome List Updates on Sep 04, 2022 - Track Awesome List

items.title: Awesome Devsecops
items.content_text:
### Newsletters

*   [Shift Security Left](https://shift-security-left.curated.co/) - *Cossack Labs* - A free biweekly newsletter for security-aware developers covering application security, secure architecture, DevSecOps, cryptography, incidents, etc. that can be useful for builders and (to a lesser extent) for breakers.
items.content_html:
Newsletters

  • Shift Security Left - Cossack Labs - A free biweekly newsletter for security-aware developers covering application security, secure architecture, DevSecOps, cryptography, incidents, etc. that can be useful for builders and (to a lesser extent) for breakers.

items.title: Awesome Appimage
items.content_text:
### AppImage developer tools / Tools to convert from other package formats

*   [arch2appimage (⭐329)](https://github.com/hanzala123/arch2appimage) - Python script to convert any Arch Linux package (official/AUR) to an AppImage.
items.content_html:
AppImage developer tools / Tools to convert from other package formats

  • arch2appimage (⭐329) - Python script to convert any Arch Linux package (official/AUR) to an AppImage.

items.title: Awesome Blazor
items.content_text:
### Videos / Others

*   [Blazor in 100 Seconds](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QXxNlpjnulI) - ![duration](https://img.shields.io/badge/Duration:%20-2%20min-%230094FF?style=flat-square\&cacheSeconds=maxAge\&logo=youtube) September 1, 2022 - Short presentation of Blazor. Blazor is a framework that can build frontend web applications with HTML, CSS, and C#. It leverages web assembly to eliminate JavaScript from the usual client-side tech stack.
items.content_html:
Videos / Others

  • Blazor in 100 Seconds - September 1, 2022 - Short presentation of Blazor. Blazor is a framework that can build frontend web applications with HTML, CSS, and C#. It leverages web assembly to eliminate JavaScript from the usual client-side tech stack.

items.title: Awesome Ava
items.content_text:
### Packages

*   [ava-typescript-worker (⭐2)](https://github.com/seamapi/ava-typescript-worker) - use TypeScript in shared workers
items.content_html:
Packages

  • ava-typescript-worker (⭐2) - use TypeScript in shared workers

items.title: Awesome Vite
items.content_text:
### Framework-agnostic Plugins / Helpers

*   [vite-plugin-validate-env (⭐205)](https://github.com/Julien-R44/vite-plugin-validate-env) - Validate your environment variables at build time. Never forget an environment variable again.
items.content_html:
Framework-agnostic Plugins / Helpers

  • vite-plugin-validate-env (⭐205) - Validate your environment variables at build time. Never forget an environment variable again.

items.title: Awesome AutoHotkey
items.content_text:
### Interpreter / Web

*   [AHK\_X11 (⭐928)](https://github.com/phil294/AHK_X11) A rudimentary but functional implementation of AutoHotkey v1.0.24 for Linux by phil294. [Forum](https://www.autohotkey.com/boards/viewtopic.php?f=81\&t=106640)
*   [Keysharp](https://bitbucket.org/mfeemster/keysharp/src/master/) - Continuation of IronAHK by mfeemster. [Forum](https://www.autohotkey.com/boards/viewtopic.php?f=80\&t=77248)

### Integrated Development Environment / Web

*   [AutoHotkey Plus Plus](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=mark-wiemer.vscode-autohotkey-plus-plus) AutoHotkey IntelliSense, debug, and language support for VS Code, forked by Mark Wiemer from AutoHotkey Plus by cweijan
items.content_html:
Interpreter / Web

  • AHK_X11 (⭐928) A rudimentary but functional implementation of AutoHotkey v1.0.24 for Linux by phil294. Forum
  • Keysharp - Continuation of IronAHK by mfeemster. Forum

Integrated Development Environment / Web

  • AutoHotkey Plus Plus AutoHotkey IntelliSense, debug, and language support for VS Code, forked by Mark Wiemer from AutoHotkey Plus by cweijan
